thread.title: Australian mosque leader tells violent Muslims to leave country
thread.title_full: Australian mosque leader tells violent Muslims to leave country | News24

author: news24.com
title: Australian mosque leader tells violent Muslims to leave country
text:
Sydney - The leader of the Sydney mosque attended by a 15-year-old who killed a police worker has called for an end to violent extremism, saying on Friday that Muslims who reject Australian values should leave the country.
Radicalised Farhad Jabar, who shot dead the 58-year-old last week while reportedly shouting religious slogans before dying in a gunbattle with police, was a regular at the mosque in the western multi-cultural Parramatta district.
Mosque chairperson Neil El-Kadomi explained to reporters what he had told the faithful at morning prayers and ahead of a planned evening protest by right-wingers to close the building down.
"I said you waited long time to come to this country. You should not abuse the privilege you are Australian, which is very important.
